channel.title: Java applet compile errors - Need fix!
channel.description:
I am currently trying to revive an old Jagex applet called The Bottomless Pit. How can I fix these compile errors?
[sup]C:\Users\Chazlie\Desktop\pit>javac pit.java pit.java:1: package jagex does not exist import jagex.*; ^ pit.java:6: cannot find symbol symbol: class g public class pit extends g ^ pit.java:295: cannot find symbol symbol : class d location: class pit d d; ^ pit.java:296: cannot find symbol symbol : class e location: class pit e e; ^ pit.java:297: cannot find symbol symbol : class a location: class pit a a; ^ pit.java:162: cannot find symbol symbol : method drawImage(java.awt.Image,int,int,pit) location: class java.awt.Graphics j.drawImage(t, 0, 0, this); ^ pit.java:191: cannot find symbol symbol : method getFontMetrics(java.awt.Font) location: class pit fontmetrics = getFontMetrics(font); ^ pit.java:206: package jagex does not exist jagex.c.a(10); ^ pit.java:207: b() in pit cannot be applied to (int) b(40); ^ pit.java:208: cannot find symbol symbol : method createImage(int,int) location: class pit t = createImage(400, 400); ^ pit.java:209: cannot find symbol symbol : method getGraphics() location: class pit j = getGraphics(); ^ pit.java:212: cannot find symbol symbol : method getCodeBase() location: class pit m = getAudioClip(getCodeBase(), "scale.au"); ^ pit.java:218: package jagex does not exist jagex.c.a(50); ^ pit.java:220: cannot find symbol symbol : class d location: class pit d = new d(400, 400, 10, this); ^ pit.java:221: cannot find symbol symbol : class a location: class pit a = new a(d, 50, 50, 50); ^ pit.java:223: cannot find symbol symbol : class e location: class pit e = new e(80, 40); ^ pit.java:283: b() in pit cannot be applied to (int,int,java.lang.String,boolean)
pit1.b(400, 400, "The bottomless pit!", false); ^ 17 errors
C:\Users\Chazlie\Desktop\pit>pause Press any key to continue . . .[/sup]

item.title: Java applet compile errors - Need fix!
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

It was obfuscated, and you didn’t deobfuscate it and refactor it properly.

Read full topic
item.source: Java applet compile errors - Need fix!

item.title: Java applet compile errors - Need fix!
item.dc:creator: @burizo burizo
item.description:
@burizo wrote:

I am currently trying to revive an old Jagex applet called The Bottomless Pit. How can I fix these compile errors?

[sup]C:\Users\Chazlie\Desktop\pit>javac pit.java
pit.java:1: package jagex does not exist
import jagex.*;
^
pit.java:6: cannot find symbol
symbol: class g
public class pit extends g
^
pit.java:295: cannot find symbol
symbol : class d
location: class pit
d d;
^
pit.java:296: cannot find symbol
symbol : class e
location: class pit
e e;
^
pit.java:297: cannot find symbol
symbol : class a
location: class pit
a a;
^
pit.java:162: cannot find symbol
symbol : method drawImage(java.awt.Image,int,int,pit)
location: class java.awt.Graphics
j.drawImage(t, 0, 0, this);
^
pit.java:191: cannot find symbol
symbol : method getFontMetrics(java.awt.Font)
location: class pit
fontmetrics = getFontMetrics(font);
^
pit.java:206: package jagex does not exist
jagex.c.a(10);
^
pit.java:207: b() in pit cannot be applied to (int)
b(40);
^
pit.java:208: cannot find symbol
symbol : method createImage(int,int)
location: class pit
t = createImage(400, 400);
^
pit.java:209: cannot find symbol
symbol : method getGraphics()
location: class pit
j = getGraphics();
^
pit.java:212: cannot find symbol
symbol : method getCodeBase()
location: class pit
m = getAudioClip(getCodeBase(), “scale.au”);
^
pit.java:218: package jagex does not exist
jagex.c.a(50);
^
pit.java:220: cannot find symbol
symbol : class d
location: class pit
d = new d(400, 400, 10, this);
^
pit.java:221: cannot find symbol
symbol : class a
location: class pit
a = new a(d, 50, 50, 50);
^
pit.java:223: cannot find symbol
symbol : class e
location: class pit
e = new e(80, 40);
^
pit.java:283: b() in pit cannot be applied to (int,int,java.lang.String,boolean)

    pit1.b(400, 400, "The bottomless pit!", false);
        ^

17 errors

C:\Users\Chazlie\Desktop\pit>pause
Press any key to continue . . .[/sup]

Read full topic
item.source: Java applet compile errors - Need fix!
